intro: Dryandra anatona, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dryandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and distinctive floral structures. The plant produces dense clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring. It is adapted to nutrient-poor soils and is often found in heathland and woodland environments. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
